internationalizations.description:
I hack, develop and sometimes make music. In May, 2020 I was encouraged by some Hackers, this burning curiosity results in following my passion and to read related writeups. I used to spend hours in a row trying to learn as much as possible about the bugs and interact with python. Participating in online hacks and competitions, was a power kick, and scoring in top 2000 at Tryhackme, helped me to build practical knowledge in the domain.

At that time, I just did not know the exciting challenges that were yet to come.

A few months later, I got an internship as a Penetration Tester at Fineoutput Technologies. Using python as a backbone of hacking, got myself as a senior software developer also, in the same company, since then I never stopped. Worked in many part-time and online internships as Penetration Tester. Having the chance to work with marvelous people, learning every day, and real-life security and bug patches, testing for uncountable hours was an amazing experience.

The hunger to learn, pushed me into my rough days of preparation for many international exams and certifications. Still it is unfulfilled.

Nowadays, I keep seeking new skills, opportunities to overcome my weaknesses and sharing my humble knowledge as much as possible.
